p: The combination of tapered optical fibres with fibre loop ring down technology was reported by Wu [ 87]. The sensing principle is based on the dependence on the external RI of the ring-down time, referred to as the time when the light intensity I decreases to 1/e of its initial value. Results showed that the sensitivity of this simple scheme could reach −388.581 μs/RIU with the detection limit below 2.57 × 10 −5 RIU [ 87]. In another configuration, a Sagnac loop, in combination with a reflective tapered fibre coupler, was used to measure RI [ 88]. The sensor showed a sensitivity of 3617 nm/RIU for measuring RI in the range 1.33–1.41.
